intro: Tithymalus purpureus, commonly known as the purple tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Tithymalus purpureus is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
